description: By examining the interaction of people and environment on the North American continent
from the 15th century to the present, this course shows how history "takes place" in
ecological contexts that change over time.  Students compare Native American and
Euro-American religious beliefs, social values, economic aspirations, and technological
developments and examine their consequences for the flora, fauna, and peoples of the
continent. Counts toward American studies major, environmental studies major (all
emphases) and concentration, and management studies concentration.
